content.description:
Follow a series of flakes and cracks going up a dihedral. The dihedral just right of the "nosey" prow. Standard rack.
Bolted rap/anchor.

Find your way along the face just to the right of Bloody Hand's crack. 
 originaly the route had been done without fixed gear.

5+ bolts, small rack may still be needed.

Very technical route on small holds (classic Val-Da). At the beginning you can't use the block on your right, you just have to do the face. The crux of the 4th bolt is intriguing and followed by several moves that will make you think.

Route très technique sur de petite prise (classique Val-Da). Au départ vous ne pouvez pas utiliser le bloc à votre droite il faut simplement faire la face. Le crux de la 4e bolt est intrigant et suivi de plusieurs moves qui vous ferons réfléchir. 



The rightmost line of the cliff behind the needle. Remains in the shade almost all the time.

La ligne la plus à droite du cliff derrière l’aiguille. Reste dans l’ombre presque tout le temps.


Bolts and small cams for the end.

Bolts et de petits cams pour la fin.

climbs.name: Double fissure classique
climbs.fa: Normand Cadieux, Edouard Pierre Gagnon  June '77

content.description:
Start below the route and climb out left onto some blocky ledges. Traverse right to the SECOND crack about level with the second bolt of DF Directe [don't go to bolt]. Climb up this crack until it's possible to traverse right again to gain the bottom of the right facing corner. Now go straight up.

Look for a high shallow right facing corner with 2 bolts below it
Standard rack

Start to the right of the 2 bolts. Climb up then left to 2 bolts then finish in the shallow right facing corner crack.

Find 2 bolts below a shallow right facing corner crack
Standard rack + 2 bolts

A remarkable route for the time! Climb up the sustained dihedral. Left of the nose like prow and to the right of a dihedral capped by a roof. standard rack
bolted anchor

The Appetizer. An interesting route using many different techniques. 
 Start as for 'Spannungsbogen' but continue along the arete.

rack + 1 bolt

A very nice problem in surface roughness. 
 Climb up and right to a high first bolt [possible nut in horizontal]. Climb higher and slightly right to a high second bolt. Finish straight up.

Left of a left facing dihedral.
6 bolts + anchor

A beautiful clean left facing corner. 
 Face climb slightly left to a horizontal and make an exposed traverse back right into the dihedral. Good gear from here.

This is the left facing corner behind the Needle of Rock
Small rack

Obvious corner to the right of the Bloody routes and exiting to the right of the roof.

large gear needed.

climbs.name: Les Mauvais compagnons
climbs.fa: TR Louis Babin '87 / FFA Benoit Dubé, Bruno Haché  June '88

content.description:
Climb up to a left facing, right leaning corner. Climb this ramp past a couple of bolts on the left, then traverse up and left over the third bolt. Up past two more bolts to anchor. 
  
 Going direct past the first three bolts is 5.12c

A steep wall below a large block on the summit, with 2 widely spaced anchor bolts with quick-links.
5 bolts + anchor

Short route leading to a small roof with two different finishes. Once you pass the roof on its left, you can continue straight up or wander a bit right on the face towards the arete and return left. Courte voie qui mene a un petit toit avec deux choix, continuer tout droit ou se deplacer vers l'arete a droite et revenir a gauche. Mixed route, 3 bolts and a small rack.

Mix, 3 scellements et un petit rack. Start right below the right nostril of the nose (left of the arete, left of the small roof).

Juste en dessous de la narine droite du nez (a gauche de l'arete a la gauche du petit toit)

head up the face under the blocky roof, exit by the left side.

4+ bolts, small rack may still be needed.

Welcome to some granitic face climbing! This thing includes tricky face climbing, a steep bouldery sequence and some roof moves.  
  
 Start underneath two giant cubical boulder. Get established on the top of the giant boulders and start climbing the right side of the arete to a bolt. Mantle to a tiny ledge, clip a second bolt and traverse left to get a stance beneath the nose. Boulder the shit out of this piece of rock to a stance then to just underneath the roof. Pull the roof and get to the anchor.

This route is located left of L'Aiguille. Its the arete that has a prominent nose on it at 2/3 of its height. You start beneath two giant cubical boulder.
5 bolts + Anchor

Climb up the blocks as for Double Fissure Classique but instead of traversing, go up the left side of the arete to a crack. Switch sides on the arete to reach another crack that runs to the top. 

Blocky ledges left of a high shallow right facing corner
Standard rack
In German, 'Spannungsbogen' has only one meaning: An arc (Bogen) or sequence of events that creates suspense or tension (Spannung).

climbs.name: Troisième dimension
climbs.fa: FA: Paul Laperrière, André Laperrière, 1974 FFA: Paul Laperrière 1979

content.description:
Thin crack that begins in a compact dihedral, the crack then widens to fingers/tips. Great locks.

_____________

Fissure très mince commençant dans un diedre encaissé qui deviens rapidement assez large pour le bout des doigts. Superbes coincements.



The Thin crack that begins in a compact dihedral on the ledge just right of Double Fissure.

_____________

La fissure mince commençant dans un diedre encaissé sur la vire juste à droite de Double Fissure.


Single rack, small nuts, double finger sizes

_____________ 

Rack simple, petites nuts, double dans les doigts

Left side of the Needle.
You can follow the cliff base towards the left, past a little cave to a clearing where you can switchback uphill to reach the top of the cliff.

Côté gauche de l'aiguille.
Vous pouvez suivre la base de la falaise vers la gauche, en passant devant une petite grotte jusqu'à une clairière où vous pouvez remonter pour atteindre le sommet de la falaise.
